1.text: A soft answer turneth away wrath; But a grievous word stirreth up anger.

2.text: The tongue of the wise uttereth knowledge aright; But the mouth of fools poureth out folly.

3.text: The eyes of Jehovah are in every place, Keeping watch upon the evil and the good.

4.text: A gentle tongue is a tree of life; But perverseness therein is a breaking of the spirit.

5.text: A fool despiseth his fatherâ€™s correction; But he that regardeth reproof getteth prudence.

6.text: In the house of the righteous is much treasure; But in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.

7.text: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge; But the heart of the foolish doeth not so.

8.text: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to Jehovah; But the prayer of the upright is his delight.

9.text: The way of the wicked is an abomination to Jehovah; But he loveth him that followeth after righteousness.

10.text: There is grievous correction for him that forsaketh the way; And he that hateth reproof shall die.

11.text: Sheol and Abaddon are before Jehovah: How much more then the hearts of the children of men!

12.text: A scoffer loveth not to be reproved; He will not go unto the wise.

13.text: A glad heart maketh a cheerful countenance; But by sorrow of heart the spirit is broken.

14.text: The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge; But the mouth of fools feedeth on folly.

15.text: All the days of the afflicted are evil; But he that is of a cheerful heart hath a continual feast.

16.text: Better is little, with the fear of Jehovah, Than great treasure and trouble therewith.

17.text: Better is a dinner of herbs, where love is, Than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.

18.text: A wrathful man stirreth up contention; But he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.

19.text: The way of the sluggard is as a hedge of thorns; But the path of the upright is made a highway.

20.text: A wise son maketh a glad father; But a foolish man despiseth his mother.

21.text: Folly is joy to him that is void of wisdom; But a man of understanding maketh straight his going.

22.text: Where there is no counsel, purposes are disappointed; But in the multitude of counsellors they are established.

23.text: A man hath joy in the answer of his mouth; And a word in due season, how good is it!

24.text: To the wise the way of life goeth upward, That he may depart from Sheol beneath.

25.text: Jehovah will root up the house of the proud; But he will establish the border of the widow.

26.text: Evil devices are an abomination to Jehovah; But pleasant words are pure.

27.text: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; But he that hateth bribes shall live.

28.text: The heart of the righteous studieth to answer; But the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.

29.text: Jehovah is far from the wicked; But he heareth the prayer of the righteous.

30.text: The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart; And good tidings make the bones fat.

31.text: The ear that hearkeneth to the reproof of life Shall abide among the wise.

32.text: He that refuseth correction despiseth his own soul; But he that hearkeneth to reproof getteth understanding.

33.text: The fear of Jehovah is the instruction of wisdom; And before honor goeth humility.
